definition: a type of standing harp, smaller than konghou 箜篌, with 5-25 strings

sentences.english: Good - bye, Gian Battista. Kiss the little ones for me . Good - bye, Teresa.
sentences.chinese: 那天下午亞瑟感到有必要多散一會兒步。

sentences.english: The Round Table broke up following the death of Arthur.
sentences.chinese: 亞瑟死後，圓桌騎士各奔東西。

sentences.english: He grew upin Port Arthur, Tex., never knowing his father.
sentences.chinese: 他在亞瑟港長大，從不知道父親是誰。

sentences.english: The stories of the Knights of the Round Table make up the Arthurian cycle.
sentences.chinese: 亞瑟王傳奇是由一些圓桌武士的故事構成。
“你自己動手，”亞瑟不客氣地說。

sentences.english: Now people were convinced that Authur was pointed out by Heaven as their king.
sentences.chinese: 這時人們相信亞瑟稱王是天意。

sentences.english: He pulled the sword out of the stone and became the new King of England.
sentences.chinese: 亞瑟把劍拔了出來，成爲了英格蘭的新國王。

sentences.english: For all his star-gazing, Sir Arthur's feet were firmly on the ground.
sentences.chinese: 儘管他耽於幻想，亞瑟爵士的足跡卻是堅實的。

sentences.english: Based on a king Arthur and the sorcerers story.
sentences.chinese: 本劇根據亞瑟王與魔法師梅林的故事改編。

sentences.english: Below is my reply to Jacek in Poland regarding two mantras.
sentences.chinese: 以下是我回覆在波蘭的亞瑟有關兩個咒子的請益。

sentences.english: Cora worshippers painter Arthur but suicide in the home.
sentences.chinese: 科拉的崇拜者畫家亞瑟卻在家中自殺身亡。

sentences.english: Why is the War of Resistance Against Japan a protracted war?
sentences.chinese: 亞瑟對抗莫德雷德的戰爭持續了很久。

sentences.english: That day and the next, Arthur refused to leave the Chimney Rock.
sentences.chinese: 之後的日子裏，亞瑟待在煙囪巖上寸步不離。

sentences.english: You're behind the times, Arthur, you're old-fashioned.
sentences.chinese: 你落伍了，亞瑟，你太老套。

sentences.english: Lancelot and Guenevere, the queen, fell in love at Arthur’s court.
sentences.chinese: 在亞瑟的宮廷裏，朗斯洛開始與王后圭內維爾相愛。

sentences.english: Suppose that Arthur is the son of Septimus and Cedrella.
sentences.chinese: 假設亞瑟是西帕提姆斯和瑟德瑞拉的兒子。

definition: (of a person) to turn round/to face about/(of a widow) to remarry (archaic)
to wave one's hand/to gesture with one's hand (beckoning, waving good-bye etc)/to swing one's arms
to turn one's head/to turn around
